title: Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vectors
text: Homework6 package implements S4 class called sparse_numeric working sparse numeric vectors R. Instead storing every element vector, stores non-zero values positions, memory-efficient large, mostly-zero vectors. package provides: sparse_numeric S4 class (slots value, pos, length) Coercion base numeric vectors sparse_numeric Arithmetic operations sparse vectors: +, -, * sparse_crossprod() dot products mean() method correctly includes implicit zeros norm() method Euclidean (L2) norm standardize() z-score sparse vector (mean 0, sd 1)

title: Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vectors
text: example shows create sparse vector, compute mean norm, standardize :
code: library(Homework6) #>  #> Attaching package: 'Homework6' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     mean, norm  # start with a dense numeric vector x_dense <- c(0, 5, 0, -2, 0, 3)  # convert to sparse_numeric x_sparse <- as(x_dense, "sparse_numeric")  # look at the sparse representation and dense version x_sparse #> Sparse numeric vector of length 6  #> Non-zero positions: 2 4 6  #> Values: 5 -2 3 as(x_sparse, "numeric") #> [1]  0  5  0 -2  0  3 # summary functions mean_x   <- mean(x_sparse)   # includes implicit zeros norm_x   <- norm(x_sparse)   # Euclidean norm  x_std    <- standardize(x_sparse) x_std_dn <- as(x_std, "numeric")  mean_x #> [1] 1 norm_x #> [1] 6.164414 x_std_dn #> [1] -0.3952847  1.5811388 -0.3952847 -1.1858541 -0.3952847  0.7905694 mean(x_std_dn) #> [1] 0 sd(x_std_dn) #> [1] 1

title: Sparse numeric vector class — sparse_numeric-class
text: e1 + e2: Element-wise addition (+) sparse_numeric vectors e1 - e2: Element-wise subtraction (-) sparse_numeric vectors e1 * e2: Element-wise multiplication (*) sparse_numeric vectors

title: Sparse numeric vector class — sparse_numeric-class
text: value Numeric vector non-zero values. pos Integer vector positions (1-based) non-zero values. length Integer giving full length underlying dense vector.

title: Standardize a sparse_numeric vector — standardize
text: Standardizes sparse_numeric vector subtracting mean dividing standard deviation. Implicit zeros included calculations converting dense numeric vector back sparse_numeric.
